text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

I decided to pursue an
MBA because I wanted

to become a better leader, but
over time, as I became a mother

and I see the influence
that I can have on Rafaella,
the word has broadened.
I have two kids.
They're twins.
Lucas.
The second one is Liam.
I have one son.

His name is Christian,
born in my first semester
of my second year of my MBA.

There's no best
time to have kids.

I had the kids before I
applied for grad school.

In fact, I think I
find myself deriving

a lot of my strength and
curiosity and confidence
from having kids.

It's all about knowing
my priorities--
and plan as a family--

the support of other
MBA moms and my husband,
Ernesto, an MBA student.

For my husband and I as
a dual career couple--

this time has been
challenging for both of us,
but in a good sense.

I don't deny the fact there
are times things get hard,
but it's also quite joyful.
